programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: What seems like a sweet deal turns out to be quite stinky; although the backyard boasts a well-constructed shed that has a lot of potential, the house is covered, floor-to-ceiling, with dog excrement and filled with spooky surprises.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: A 3,200-square-foot home in one of Orlando's most affluent neighborhoods has a number of problems, from a badly damaged roof and rotting walls to an alligator in the swimming pool.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: The team finds a sweet price on a time-capsule house filled with years of clutter; the old workshop in the back has been converted into a separate dwelling; the city splits it into separate addresses, creating a headache in permit delays.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: Keith finds this house on a massive lot and convinces the team to take it on. They decide the best plan is to flip the house, split the lot, and sell the extra land. When they file for the permit, Keith gets news that could open up lots of problems.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: A large corner lot is home to an ugly house that the previous owners left full of half-baked, shoddy renovations, including a master bath that opens into the hallway and a bedroom as red as the gates of hell.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: The team enters a run-down zombie house to find a microwave room full of TV dinner wrappers where the kitchen should be, a swampy pool and what looks like a grave in the backyard.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: A probate house finally becomes available to the Zombie team, and their initial walk through reveals the makings of a sweet party pad.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: When the zombie team spots a small, rundown bungalow in a highly sought-after neighborhood, they have visions of a steal of a deal that could earn a big paycheck; hidden problems like wood rot and termite infestation start demolishing their budget.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: Years of cigarette smoke stain a home's walls and leave a putrid smell throughout the property; as the flippers make over the monster, things start smelling sweeter when they uncover clues to a hidden treasure.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: The team senses a golden opportunity when they check out a zombie house and discover a hidden treasure in the backyard, a buried pool; if it can be restored, it could boost their sale price forty grand.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: A zombie house from the 90's becomes the team's latest project, but any hopes for a fast flip and a quick profit start to sour when they discover that the entire façade on the front of the house is filled with wood rot and needs to be replaced.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: Work on a giant zombie house in one of Orlando's historic districts forces the team to follow certain guidelines that could come at a historic cost.

programme.desc: The team enters a run-down zombie house to find a microwave room full of TV dinner wrappers where the kitchen should be, a swampy pool and what looks like a grave in the backyard.
